Python Module for Finite Rate of Innovation (FRI) sampling 1.0.0 documentation
previous | next | modules | index

irr_time_samp API¶

class irr_time_samp.IrrTimeSamp(K, tau, B, L)¶

simuation of irregular time samples simulation reconstruction

__init__(K, tau, B, L)¶
Parameters:
K: int

number of diracs

tau: float

period

B: float

bandwidth

L: int

number of samples
add_noise(P=inf)¶

Method for addition of noise to signal

Parameters:
P: float

SNR ratio in db

noiseless: ndarray

signal without noise

complex: bool

True if needs a imaginary noise addition, for Fourier domain samples
Returns:
withNoise: ndarray

the signal with noise

noise_level: float

the noise_level
static create_samples(L, tau, Tmax)¶

Creates the L time samples of x(t)

static dir_loc(K, tau, L)¶

Diracs locations generator

static fourier_coeff(ak, tk, B, tau, t_samp)¶

Computation of noiseless Fourier series coefficients

plot(save_fig=False, fig_format='png')¶

Plotting method of the results

Parameters:
save_fig:boolean corresponding if the plot has to be saved or not
fig_format:the image format with which the file will be stored if save_fig is True
reconstruction(stop_cri='max_iter', max_ini=100)¶

Main method of the clas. This reconstructs the signal according to the algorithm.

Parameters:
stop_cri: str

the stopping criteria of the algorithm, can either be mse or max_iter

max_ini: int

maximum number of random initialisations
save_results(simName)¶

save the results to the results file

Parameters:
simName: str

string naming the file
setup(G=None, a=None)¶

Setup the measurements a and the linear matrix G. If one of them isn’t given, function sets up random measurements a according to a Poisson distribution

Parameters:
G: numpy.ndarray

linear mapping between the sampled signal and the measurements, (L x M) matrix

a: numpy.ndarray

(L x 2) matrix. First column are the time and second the amplitude of the measurements.
show_results()¶

Prints the some results after performing FRI reconstruction

Returns:
pandas.DataFrame
